intro: Draba hispanica subsp. djurdjurae, commonly known as the Spanish rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. This subspecies typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. The plant has basal leaves that are often glaucous, and its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in alpine ecosystems and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche.
